New Records: South Korea secured a 3-0 victory over China in World Cup qualifying, with Son Heung-min scoring twice and Jung Seung-hyun adding the third goal.
Son Heung-min became a key figure in South Korea's win with his two goals and one assist, contributing to new team achievements and individual records.
Key Match Events: Son Heung-min scored a decisive penalty in the 11th minute after Hwang Hee-chan was fouled in the area.
South Korea's second goal came just before halftime with Son Heung-min heading in a cross.
Jung Seung-hyun scored the third goal with a header off a free kick from Son Heung-min.
Pre-Game Insights: South Korea's coach Jurgen Klinsmann emphasized the importance of the win and the team's resilience despite China's scoring opportunities.
The match was significant for South Korea's qualification hopes, aiming to reach the World Cup for the 11th consecutive time.
Post-Match Reflections: Jurgen Klinsmann praised the team's performance and the impact of scoring early, which lifted the atmosphere.
The victory strengthens South Korea's position in Group C of World Cup qualifying.
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Korea's win marked their second consecutive victory in World Cup qualifying.
The match highlighted Son Heung-min's leadership and key contributions to the team's success.
